cards.name: Osai Vultures
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of each end step, if a creature died this turn, put a carrion counter on Osai Vultures.
Remove two carrion counters from Osai Vultures: Osai Vultures gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Only gets one counter per turn, not one per creature.

cards.originalText:
Flying
At the end of any turn in which a creature is put into the graveyard from play, put a carrion counter on Vultures.
{0}: Remove two carrion counters to give Vultures +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Pearled Unicorn
cards.flavor: "'Do you know, I always thought Unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before!' 'Well, now that we have seen each other,' said the Unicorn, 'if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you.'" —Lewis Carroll

cards.name: Personal Incarnation
cards.text:
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Personal Incarnation this turn is dealt to its owner instead. Only Personal Incarnation's owner may activate this ability.
When Personal Incarnation dies, its owner loses half their life, rounded up.

rulings.text: You do not lose life if this card is exiled or sent someplace without going to the graveyard first.
The owner of the Incarnation loses life when it is destroyed, not the controller. So if you control your opponent's Incarnation you can let it die to make them lose life.
If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0. This means that the life total stays the same. A life total of -10 would remain -10.

cards.originalText: Owner may redirect any or all damage done to Personal Incarnation to self instead. If Personal Incarnation is put into the graveyard from play, owner loses half his or her remaining life, rounding up the loss. Effects that redirect or prevent damage cannot be used to counter this loss of life.

cards.name: Piety
cards.text: Blocking creatures get +0/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Whoever obeys God and His Prophet, fears God and does his duty to Him, will surely find success."
—The Qur'an, 24:52
cards.originalText: All blocking creatures get +0/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Pikemen
cards.text: First strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor:
"As the cavalry bore down, we faced them with swords drawn and pikes hidden in the grass at our feet. 'Don't lift your pikes 'til I give the word,' I said."
—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText: Banding, first strike

cards.name: Purelace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes white. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)
cards.originalText: Change the color of target spell or target permanent to white. Costs to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target remain unchanged.

cards.name: Red Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from red. This effect doesn't remove Red Ward.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains protection from red. The protection granted by Red Ward does not destroy Red Ward.

cards.name: Reverse Damage
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

rulings.text: It only affects damage dealt by the source one time. If the source damages you a second time this turn, the damage will not be reversed.

cards.originalText: All damage dealt to you so far this turn by one source is retroactively added to your life total instead of subtracted. Further damage this turn is treated normally.

cards.name: Righteousness
cards.text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

rulings.text: A "blocking creature" is one that has been declared as a blocker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield blocking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be a blocking creature through the end of combat step, even if the creature or creatures it was blocking are no longer on the battlefield or have otherwise left combat.

cards.originalText: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

cards.name: Samite Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent 1 damage to any creature or player.

cards.name: Savannah Lions
cards.flavor: The traditional kings of the jungle command a healthy respect in other climates as well. Relying mainly on their stealth and speed, Savannah Lions can take a victim by surprise, even in the endless, flat plains of their homeland.

cards.name: Seeker
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or white creatures.
cards.originalText: Target creature cannot be blocked except by white creatures and artifact creatures.

cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor: Born with wings of light and a sword of faith, this heavenly incarnation embodies both fury and purity.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Attacking does not cause Serra Angel to tap.

cards.name: Spirit Link
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

rulings.text: You only gain the life when the triggered ability resolves. If you are reduced to zero life before the ability resolves, you will lose before gaining the life.

You gain life for all damage which is not prevented, regardless of what the creature damages (player or another creature) or the toughness of the blocking creature. If you put this on a 5/5 and it is blocked by a 1/1, you still gain 5 life.

cards.originalText: Gain 1 life for every 1 damage target creature deals. You may gain more life than the toughness or the total life of the creature or player damaged by the creature Spirit Link enchants.

cards.name: Swords to Plowshares
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

rulings.text: The amount of life gained is equal to the power of the targeted creature as it last existed on the battlefield.
If the creature's power is negative, its controller doesn't lose or gain life.

cards.originalText: Remove target creature from the game. The creature's controller gains life equal to its power.

cards.name: Tundra Wolves
cards.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor: I heard their eerie howling, the wolves calling their kindred across the frozen plains.
cards.originalText: First strike

cards.name: Visions
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of target player's library. You may then have that player shuffle that library.
cards.flavor:
"Visions of glory, spare my aching sight,
Ye unborn ages, crowd not on my soul!"
—Thomas Gray, "The Bard"

rulings.text: You can't rearrange the cards. You put them back in the same order or have the whole library shuffled.
If there are less than 5 cards in the library, you look at whatever ones remain and you still get the option to shuffle.
This is not a draw and will not cause a player to lose if there are less than 5 cards in the library.

cards.originalText: Look at the top five cards of any library. You may then shuffle that library.

cards.name: Wall of Swords
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
cards.flavor: Just as the evil ones approached to slay Justina, she cast a great spell, imbuing her weapons with her own life force. Thus she fulfilled the prophecy: "In the death of your savior will you find salvation."
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: White Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
cards.flavor: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the Knight had just laid waste.
cards.originalText: Protection from black, first strike

cards.name: White Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from white. This effect doesn't remove White Ward.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains protection from white. The protection granted by White Ward does not destroy White Ward.

cards.name: Wrath of God
cards.text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Bury all creatures.

cards.name: Swamp
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Swamp
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Swamp
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Forest
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Forest
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Forest
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Strip Mine
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Sacrifice Strip Mine: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor: Unlike previous conflicts, the war between Urza and Mishra made Dominia itself a casualty of war.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{T}: Sacrifice Strip Mine to destroy target land.

cards.name: Mountain
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Mountain
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Mountain
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Plains
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Plains
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Plains
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Mishra's Factory
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}: Mishra's Factory becomes a 2/2 Assembly-Worker artifact creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
{T}: Target Assembly-Worker creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: If another player takes control of the Factory while it is animated, that player keeps control until the control effect ends. They do not lose control just because the card stops being an Assembly-Worker. Note that Auras which steal cards will go to the graveyard if the permanent they enchant is no longer valid.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.
Once turned into a creature, Mishra's Factory's last ability can target itself. If it's already blocking, this won't remove it from combat.
If you turn Mishra's Factory into a creature but haven't controlled it continuously since your most recent turn began, you won't be able to activate its first or last ability.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add 1 colorless mana to your mana pool.
{1}: Mishra's Factory becomes an Assembly Worker, a 2/2 artifact creature, until end of turn. Assembly Worker still counts as a land but cannot be tapped for mana the turn it comes into play.
{T}: Target Assembly Worker gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Oasis
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent 1 damage to any creature.

cards.name: Island
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Island
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Island
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Aladdin's Lamp
cards.text: {X}, {T}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, instead look at the top X cards of your library, put all but one of them on the bottom of your library in a random order, then draw a card. X can't be 0.

rulings.text: If you use more than one Lamp effect, the second one will end up replacing the card being drawn with the first one.

cards.originalText: {X}, {T}: Instead of drawing a card from the top of your library, draw X cards but choose only one to put in your hand. You must shuffle the leftover cards and put them at the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Aladdin's Ring
cards.text: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: "After these words the magician drew a ring off his finger, and put it on one of Aladdin's, saying: 'It is a talisman against all evil, so long as you obey me.'" —The Arabian Nights, Junior Classics trans.
cards.originalText: {8}, {T} Aladdin's Ring does 4 damage to any target.

cards.name: Ankh of Mishra
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

rulings.text: This triggers on any land entering the battlefield. This includes playing a land or putting a land onto the battlefield using a spell or ability.
It determines the land's controller at the time the ability resolves. If the land leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the land's last controller before it left is used.

cards.originalText: Ankh does 2 damage to anyone who puts a new land into play.

cards.name: Armageddon Clock
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a doom counter on Armageddon Clock.
At the beginning of your draw step, Armageddon Clock deals damage equal to the number of doom counters on it to each player.
{4}: Remove a doom counter from Armageddon Clock. Any player may activate this ability but only during any upkeep step.

rulings.text: Players can remove as many counters as they can pay for each turn.

cards.originalText: Put one counter on Armageddon Clock during each of your upkeeps. At the end of your upkeep, each player takes damage equal to the number of counters on the Clock. Any player may spend {4} during any upkeep to remove a counter.

cards.name: Basalt Monolith
cards.text:
Basalt Monolith doesn't untap during your untap step.
{T}: Add {C}{C}{C}.
{3}: Untap Basalt Monolith.

rulings.text: It can be untapped as often as you can pay for it.

cards.originalText: {T}: Add 3 colorless mana to your mana pool. Does not untap as normal during untap phase; you may spend {3} at any other time to untap. Drawing mana from this artifact is played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Black Vise
cards.text:
As Black Vise enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, Black Vise deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in their hand minus 4.

rulings.text: You choose one opposing player as it enters the battlefield and it only affects that one player. This choice is not changed even if Black Vise changes controllers. It becomes useless but stays on the battlefield if that player leaves the game.
If the chosen player has four or fewer cards in their hand as Black Vise's ability resolves, the ability just won't do anything that turn.

cards.originalText: If opponent has more than four cards in hand during his or her upkeep, Black Vise does 1 damage to opponent for each card in excess of four.

cards.name: Bottle of Suleiman
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice Bottle of Suleiman: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, create a 5/5 colorless Djinn artifact creature token with flying. If you lose the flip, Bottle of Suleiman deals 5 damage to you.

rulings.text: The coin is flipped on resolution and not on declaration of the ability.

cards.originalText: {1}: Flip a coin, with opponent calling heads or tails while coin is in the air. If the flip ends up in opponent's favor, Bottle of Suleiman does 5 damage to you. Otherwise, a 5/5 flying Djinn immediately comes into play on your side. Use a counter to represent Djinn. Djinn is treated exactly like a normal artifact creature except that if it leaves play it is removed from the game entirely. No matter how the flip turns out, Bottle of Suleiman is discarded after use.

cards.name: Brass Man
cards.text:
Brass Man doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {1}. If you do, untap Brass Man.

rulings.text: Reworded so that it triggers only once at beginning of upkeep, instead of being an activated ability usable any time during your upkeep. You can no longer make infinite combos with this ability.

cards.originalText: Brass Man does not untap as normal; you must pay {1} during your upkeep phase to untap it.

cards.name: Celestial Prism
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Provides 1 mana of any color. This use is played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Clockwork Beast
cards.text:
Clockwork Beast enters the battlefield with seven +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast to be greater than seven. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
This is a change from the most recent wording. Now, if some other spell or ability causes +1/+0 counters to be put on Clockwork Beast, it can wind up with more than seven such counters on it.

If Clockwork Beast has seven or fewer +1/+0 counters on it when its last ability resolves, it can wind up a maximum of seven such counters on it. If it has seven or more +1/+0 counters on it, the ability will have no effect.
Clockwork Beast's last ability resolves, you can choose to put fewer than X +1/+0 counters on it.

cards.originalText: Put seven +1/+0 counters on Beast. After Beast attacks or blocks a creature, discard a counter. During the upkeep phase, controller may buy back lost counters for {1} per counter; this taps Beast.

cards.name: Conservator
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Prevent the loss of up to 2 life.

cards.name: Crystal Rod
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: {1}: Any blue spell cast gives you 1 life. Can only give 1 life each time a blue spell is cast.

cards.name: Dancing Scimitar
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Bobbing merrily from opponent to opponent, the scimitar began adding playful little flourishes to its strokes; it even turned a couple of somersaults.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Dingus Egg
cards.text: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
cards.originalText: Whenever anyone loses a land, Dingus Egg does 2 damage to that player for each land lost.

cards.name: Disrupting Scepter
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.

rulings.text: You can use it on yourself.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Opponent must discard one card of his or her choice. Can only be used during controller's turn.

cards.name: Dragon Engine
cards.text: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Those who believed the city of Kroog would never fall to Mishra's forces severely underestimated the might of his war machines.

cards.name: Ebony Horse
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Untap target attacking creature you control. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Remove one of your attacking creatures from combat. Treat this as if the creature never attacked, except that defenders assigned to block it cannot choose to block another creature.

cards.name: Flying Carpet
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Gives one creature flying ability until end of turn. If that creature is destroyed before end of turn, so is Flying Carpet.

cards.name: Glasses of Urza
cards.text: {T}: Look at target player's hand.
cards.originalText: {T}: You may look at opponent's hand.

cards.name: Helm of Chatzuk
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding a player controls are blocking or being blocked by a creature, that player divides that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: You may give one creature banding ability until end of turn.

cards.name: Howling Mine
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.

rulings.text: If Howling Mine leaves the battlefield before it resolves, then the last known tap or untap state of the card is used for resolution.
It does not trigger at all if this is tapped at the start of the draw step, and it checks this again on resolution.
The additional draw is separate from any other draw during your draw step. It happens when the triggered ability resolves.
The triggered ability is put onto the stack after you have already drawn your card for the turn.

cards.originalText: Each player must draw one extra card during the draw phase of each of his or her turns.

cards.name: Iron Star
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: {1}: Any red spell cast gives you 1 life. Can only give 1 life each time a red spell is cast.

cards.name: Ivory Cup
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: {1}: Any white spell cast gives you 1 life. Can only give 1 life each time a white spell is cast.

cards.name: Ivory Tower
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain X life, where X is the number of cards in your hand minus 4.
cards.flavor: Valuing scholarship above all else, the inhabitants of the Ivory Tower reward those who sacrifice power for knowledge.

rulings.text: If you have four or fewer cards in your hand when Ivory Tower's ability resolves, the ability has no effect.

cards.originalText: During your upkeep phase, gain 1 life for each card in your hand above four.

cards.name: Jade Monolith
cards.text: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.
cards.originalText: {1}: You may take damage done to any creature on yourself instead, but you must take all of it. Source of damage is unchanged.

cards.name: Jandor's Ring
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Discard the last card you drew this turn: Draw a card.

rulings.text: If you do not have the card still in your hand, you can't pay the cost. There is currently no way to prove that it was the card you drew except to get a judge or 3rd party involved, or to put cards you draw aside until you decide whether or not to use this.
If you draw more than one card due to a spell or ability, you must discard the last one of those drawn.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Discard a card you just drew from your library, and draw another card to replace it.

cards.name: Jandor's Saddlebags
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Untap target creature.
cards.flavor: Each day of their journey, Jandor opened the saddlebags and found them full of mutton, quinces, cheese, date rolls, wine, and all manner of delicious and satisfying foods.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Untap a creature.

cards.name: Jayemdae Tome
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.
cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: Draw one extra card.

cards.name: Juggernaut
cards.text:
Juggernaut attacks each combat if able.
Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.
cards.flavor: We had taken refuge in a small cave, thinking the entrance was too narrow for it to follow. To our horror, its gigantic head smashed into the mountainside, ripping itself a new entrance.

rulings.text: If Juggernaut can't attack for any reason (such as being tapped or having come under that player's control that turn), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having it attack, its controller isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

cards.originalText: Must attack each turn if possible. Can't be blocked by walls.

cards.name: Kormus Bell
cards.text: All Swamps are 1/1 black creatures that are still lands.

rulings.text: The lands are both lands and creatures at the same time. They are affected by anything that affects either permanent type.
It affects Swamps controlled by any and all players.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: Treat all swamps in play as 1/1 creatures. Now they can be enchanted, killed, and so forth, and they can be tapped either for mana or to attack.

cards.name: Library of Leng
cards.text:
You have no maximum hand size.
If an effect causes you to discard a card, discard it, but you may put it on top of your library instead of into your graveyard.

rulings.text: This effect has no effect on the cards being put into the graveyard from a library, because they are not "discarded".
You can't use the Library of Leng ability to place a discarded card on top of your library when you discard a card as a cost, because costs aren't effects.
The discard triggers anything else that triggers on discards.
You can look at a randomly discarded card before deciding where it goes.

The ability applies any time a spell or ability has you discard as part of its effect. It does not matter if you or your opponent control the spell or ability. The discard is forced because it is an effect.

If more than one card is discarded due to a single effect, the Library allows you to decide whether or not to use it on each of the cards. You get to decide the order the cards are placed on the library if more than one goes there.
Since the card goes directly to the library, the card is not revealed unless the spell or ability requiring the discard specifically says it is.
The ability replaces the normal discard action with a discard action that puts the card on the library instead of the graveyard.

If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Library of Leng onto the battlefield, you'll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

cards.originalText: You must skip the discard phase of your turn. If a card forces you to discard, you may choose to discard to top of your library rather than to graveyard. If discard is random, you may look at card before deciding where to discard it.

cards.name: Living Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{1}: Regenerate Living Wall.
cards.flavor: Some fiendish mage had created a horrifying wall of living flesh, patched together from a jumble of still-recognizable body parts. As we sought to hew our way through it, some unknown power healed the gaping wounds we cut, denying us passage.
cards.originalText: Counts as a wall. {1}: Regenerates.

cards.name: Mana Vault
cards.text:
Mana Vault doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4}. If you do, untap Mana Vault.
At the beginning of your draw step, if Mana Vault is tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add {C}{C}{C}.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add 3 colorless mana to your mana pool. Mana Vault doesn't untap normally during untap phase; to untap it, you must pay 4 mana during your upkeep. If Mana Vault remains tapped during upkeep it does 1 damage to you. Drawing mana from this artifact is played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Meekstone
cards.text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
cards.originalText: Any creature with power greater than 2 may not be untapped as normal during the untap phase.

cards.name: Millstone
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor: More than one mage was driven insane by the sound of the Millstone relentlessly grinding away.

rulings.text: Can be used on a player with less than 2 cards in their library. It will remove 0 or 1 cards if that is all that is available.
It is not a draw effect so it will not cause a player with less than 2 cards in their library to lose.
Since you are putting more than one card in the graveyard at one time, the affected player can choose the order the 2 cards go in.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Take the top two cards from target player's library and put them in target player's graveyard.

cards.name: Mishra's War Machine
cards.text:
Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Mishra's War Machine deals 3 damage to you unless you discard a card. If Mishra's War Machine deals damage to you this way, tap it.

rulings.text: You may choose to take damage or to discard. You can't avoid taking damage if you have no cards to discard.

If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText:
Bands
During your upkeep, discard one card of your choice from your hand, or Mishra's War Machine becomes tapped and does 3 points of damage to you.

cards.name: Nevinyrral's Disk
cards.text:
Nevinyrral's Disk enters the battlefield tapped.
{1}, {T}: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.

rulings.text: You don't sacrifice Nevinyrral's Disk to activate its ability. It's destroyed as part of the ability's resolution if it's still on the battlefield. If an effect gives Nevinyrral's Disk indestructible or regenerates it, it stays on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: {1}: Destroys all creatures, enchantments, and artifacts in play, including Disk itself. Disk begins tapped but can be untapped as usual.

cards.name: Obsianus Golem
cards.flavor:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone..."
—Song of the Artificer

cards.name: Onulet
cards.text: When Onulet dies, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: An early inspiration for Urza, Tocasia's Onulets contained magical essences that could be cannibalized after they stopped functioning.
cards.originalText: If Onulet is placed in the graveyard, its controller gains 2 life.

cards.name: Ornithopter
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Many scholars believe that these creatures were the result of Urza's first attempt at mechanical life, perhaps created in his early days as an apprentice to Tocasia.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Primal Clay
cards.text: As Primal Clay enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 artifact creature, a 2/2 artifact creature with flying, or a 1/6 Wall artifact creature with defender in addition to its other types. (A creature with defender can't attack.)

rulings.text: In zones other than the battlefield, this creature card is 0/0.

If another permanent enters the battlefield as a copy of this creature, the controller of that permanent will get to make a new choice. The copy won't necessarily have the same power, toughness, and abilities as the original.
If a creature that's already on the battlefield becomes a copy of this creature, it copies the power, toughness, and abilities that were chosen for this creature as it entered the battlefield.

cards.originalText: When you cast Primal Clay, you must choose whether to make it a 1/6 wall, a 3/3 creature, or a 2/2 flying creature. Primal Clay then remains in this form until altered by another card or removed from play.

cards.name: Rocket Launcher
cards.text: {2}: Rocket Launcher deals 1 damage to any target. Destroy Rocket Launcher at the beginning of the next end step. Activate this ability only if you've controlled Rocket Launcher continuously since the beginning of your most recent turn.
cards.flavor: What these devices lacked in subtlety, they made up in strength.

rulings.text: You can choose different targets for each use.
Because it does not have tapping as part of its activation cost, you can activate the ability many times in one turn, but it is destroyed at the end of any turn in which you use it.
It is only destroyed at end of turn if the ability resolved. If the ability is countered, it is not sacrificed.

cards.originalText: {2}: Do 1 damage to any target. Rocket Launcher may not be used until it begins a turn in play on your side. If it is used, Rocket Launcher is destroyed at end of turn.

cards.name: Rod of Ruin
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin does 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Sol Ring
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}{C}.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add 2 colorless mana to your mana pool. This ability is played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Soul Net
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: If animated so it is a creature, it can be triggered off its own destruction.

cards.originalText: {1}: You gain 1 life every time a creature is placed in the graveyard. Can only give 1 life each time a creature is placed in the graveyard.

cards.name: Sunglasses of Urza
cards.text: You may spend white mana as though it were red mana.
cards.originalText: White mana in your mana pool can be used as either white or red mana.

cards.name: The Hive
cards.text: {5}, {T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Insect artifact creature token with flying named Wasp. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.originalText: {5}, {T}: Creates one Giant Wasp, a 1/1 flying creature. Represent Wasps with tokens, making sure to indicate when each Wasp is tapped. Wasps can't attack during the turn created. Treat Wasps like artifact creatures in every way, except that they are removed from the game entirely if they ever leave play. If the Hive is destroyed, the Wasps must still be killed individually.

cards.name: The Rack
cards.text:
As The Rack enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, The Rack deals X damage to that player, where X is 3 minus the number of cards in their hand.
cards.flavor: Invented in Mishra's earlier days, the Rack was once his most feared creation.

rulings.text: You choose one opposing player as this card enters the battlefield and it only affects that one player. This choice is not changed even if this card changes controllers. It becomes useless but stays on the battlefield if the chosen player leaves the game.

cards.originalText: If opponent has fewer than three cards in hand during his or her upkeep, the Rack does 1 damage to opponent for each card fewer than three.

cards.name: Throne of Bone
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: {1}: Any black spell cast gives you 1 life. Can only give 1 life each time a black spell is cast.

cards.name: Winter Orb
cards.text: As long as Winter Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than one land during their untap steps.

rulings.text: All permanents untap during a player's untap step at once. If Winter Orb is tapped as your untap step begins, your lands will all untap.
You can't tap Winter Orb just because you want to. Another ability, such as that of Glare of Subdual, must instruct or allow you to do so.

cards.originalText: A player may not untap more than one land during the untap phase of each of his or her turns.

cards.name: Wooden Sphere
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: {1}: Any green spell cast gives you 1 life. Can only give 1 life each time a green spell is cast.

cards.name: Animate Dead
cards.text:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
When Animate Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to the battlefield under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.

rulings.text: Animate Dead is an Aura, albeit with an unusual enchant ability. You target a creature card in a graveyard when you cast it. It enters the battlefield attached to that card. Then it returns that card to the battlefield, and attaches itself to the card again (since the card is a new object on the battlefield). Animate Dead itself never moves into a graveyard during this process.
If Animate Dead isn't on the battlefield as its triggered ability resolves, none of its effects happen. The creature card won't be returned to the battlefield.

Abilities such as shroud and protection function only on the battlefield unless otherwise specified. A creature card with shroud may be targeted by Animate Dead, and Animate Dead will become attached to the creature that enters the battlefield.

If the creature put onto the battlefield has protection from black—or if the creature can't legally be enchanted by Animate Dead for another reason—Animate Dead won't be able to attach to it. It will be put into the graveyard as a state-based action, causing its delayed triggered ability to trigger. When the trigger resolves, if the creature's still on the battlefield, its controller will sacrifice it.

Once the creature is returned to the battlefield, Animate Dead can't be attached to anything other than it (unless Animate Dead somehow manages to put a different creature onto the battlefield). Attempting to move Animate Dead to another creature won't work.

cards.originalText: Any creature in any graveyard comes into play on your side with -1 to its original power. At end of game, or if this enchantment is discarded without removing target creature from play, target creature is returned to its owner's graveyard. Target creature may be killed as normal.

cards.name: Bad Moon
cards.text: Black creatures get +1/+1.
cards.originalText: All black creatures in play gain +1/+1.

cards.name: Black Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
cards.flavor: Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight.
cards.originalText: Protection from white, first strike

cards.name: Bog Wraith
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor:
'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae
My mate did meet an early grave
'Twas nothing left for us to save
In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk

cards.name: Contract from Below
cards.text:
Remove Contract from Below from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
Discard your hand, ante the top card of your library, then draw seven cards.
cards.originalText: Discard your current hand and draw eight new cards, adding the first drawn to your ante. Remove this card from your deck before playing if you are not playing for ante.

cards.name: Cursed Land
cards.text:
Enchant land
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, Cursed Land deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: Cursed Land does 1 damage to target land's controller during his or her upkeep.

cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B}.
cards.originalText: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Darkpact
cards.text:
Remove Darkpact from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
You own target card in the ante. Exchange that card with the top card of your library.
cards.originalText: Swap top card of your library with either card of the ante; this swap is permanent. You must have a card in your library to cast this spell. Remove this card from your deck before playing if you are not playing for ante.

cards.name: Deathgrip
cards.text: {B}{B}: Counter target green spell.
cards.originalText: {B}{B}: Counter a green spell as it is being cast. This ability is played as an interrupt and does not affect green cards already in play.

cards.name: Deathlace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes black. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)
cards.originalText: Changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to black. Cost to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.
